title: About Me
text:
What I do For Work
As a Masters Student I analyze environmental data using R and Python.

title: About Me
text:
What I do for fun
In my free time, he enjoys film photography, cooking, playing guitar and go camping in his VW bus.
You can find me enjoying my collection of Soviet era film cameras. My favorite cuisine is Thai food, of which drunken noodles, larb and yellow curry are among my favorite dishes. My all time favorite dish, however is Japanese Ramen, specifically Tsukemen.

title: Joshua Ferrer-Lozano
text:
Welcome! I’m a graduate student in Environmental Data Science at UCSB.
I focus on geospatial analysis, reproducible workflows, and creative approaches to teaching data science with a background in data cleaning, climate research, and data visualization.
I double majored with degrees in Environmental Studies and Planning and Economics from Sonoma State University in 2017. In the following years, I was an AmeriCorps Vista volunteer in Hawaii and worked on environmental policy for the Caldwell Administration and co-developed the methodology for the City and County of Honolulu’s first greenhouse gas inventory as well as develop metrics for its first sustainability report. After, I was a Peace Corps volunteer in the country of Georgia where I provided capacity to a small non-government organization providing support in IT, translation, database development, data dashboard and website development and youth development project facilitation.
